title: What is so bad about being “old fashioned”? - Quora

response.answer_text: Being old-fashioned has ALWAYS been mocked by the next generation. Furthermore, we oldsters always believe the old ways are the best and the younger generation is, if you’ll pardon the word, degenerating. Please remember that when my parents were born, the KKK was supported by states’ governors and marched through Washington D.C. They were lynching blacks and attacking Catholics and Jews and immigrants who came here after World War I. In addition, women couldn’t vote. Were those the good old days? When I was born, black people still had to ride in the back of the bus, eat at “black” restaurants, watch movies at “black” theaters, use only “black” rest rooms. Were those the good old days? In my generation, the Civil Rights Era had to turn to violence to earn rights that were guaranteed to all of us in the Declaration of Independence. Remember? “…all men are created Equal”? I mocked my parents’ old-fashioned ways as I turned to rock-and-roll and the joys of computers. But now the next generation laughs when I use e-mail instead of text—come on, guys, e-mail can be saved and copied into a document and turned into a diary, don’t you see the value? I used to teach my co-workers how to use Word, and now the youngsters have to teach me how to use the newfangled technology of today. Were we really good Christians and well-behaved people when we used words like “kike” and “spic” and “n- - - - r”? Of course the new ways aren’t always right. We’re humans. We’re bound to screw up. But when you ask “what is so bad about being old-fashioned’ I have to respond, “what is so bad about being modern?” Strive to improve. Set a good example, and praise what is good instead of wailing for the way things used to be.

It’s not always bad to be “old-fashioned,” but when people think of old-fashioned, it’s usually a connotation for someone who, for example, emails instead of texts or does things “their way” instead of doing it an easier way. It’s mostly millennials criticizing baby bloomers for sometimes being a bit stubborn when it comes to adapting to new things or technology. But being old-fashioned doesn’t have to be bad all the time. If you still own a VHS like I do, more power to you, you can still watch old films (of course my definition of old may be different from others) that used VCR’s. And especially when it comes to fashion, this generation has brought back many styles: mom jeans, scrunchies, high-legged cut bathing suits, wide-legged pants, and more. These are the items that are becoming more and more trendy. Hope this helps :)
